fulltext: doi:10.18419/darus-471;2020-01-29T01:00:00Z;all;10.18419/darus-471;Koch, Timo;Timo;Koch;0000-0003-4776-5222;Universität Stuttgart;Benchmark C1.2 - Numerical results reference solution;DaRUS;2020;Agricultural Sciences;Computer and Information Science;Earth and Environmental Sciences;Koch, Timo;Timo;Koch;Universität Stuttgart;Magdalena Landl;Magdalena;Landl;2019-09-23;2020-01-28;simulation results, post-processing, data files;10.1101/808972;22259562;113866;42029509;20777;19057;58794;87045483;4563116365;4533451082;application/gzip;application/gzip;application/gzip;application/gzip;application/gzip;application/octet-stream;model/mesh;application/gzip;application/gzip;1.0;CC BY Waiver;Root water uptake simulation with a numerical scheme where the root-soil surface is explicitly resolved by the computational grid. The roots are a one-dimensional network grid embedded in a 3D soil domain. This dataset contains the grid files for root and soil. 8-day-old lupine, segmented from MRI measurements (courtesy of Magdalena Landl, FZ Jülich, Germany). Soil grid generated with CGAL from implicit description.
